page.title: 03TRANSPORT IN EAGLESFIELD
page.content: Eaglesfield is situated close to the A74{road}which traverses the south-west end of the original main street.At this point the railway line is crossed by the dual-carriageway and where the disused station once stood.There is still evidence of the sidings and branch line which were presumably used by the quarries which once operated in the area.Although there is now a flyover farm traffic still has to use the A74 and this causes problems as drivers coming through from the motorways are not always aware of this fact and there have been a number of fatal accidents. To use the{railway}you have to go to Lockerbie, Annan or Carlisle. { Buses}run to Lockerbie, Annan or Carlisle but are expensive and not well used as most people have{cars.}
